title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
synopsis: A young girl navigates racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South during the 1930s.

author: George Orwell
synopsis: In a totalitarian society under constant surveillance, a man questions the regime's oppressive control.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
synopsis: Elizabeth Bennet deals with issues of manners, marriage, and morality in 19th-century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
synopsis: A mysterious millionaire's obsession with a past love leads to tragedy in Jazz Age America.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
synopsis: A tale of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set in war-torn Afghanistan.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
synopsis: A deeply personal account of the former First Lady's life and legacy.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
synopsis: The story of Circe, a sorceress from Greek mythology, as she discovers her powers and identity.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
synopsis: In a deadly game of survival, a young girl becomes a symbol of rebellion.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
synopsis: An aging Hollywood icon reflects on her glamorous, scandalous life and loves.

title: Rich Dad Poor Dad

synopsis: A financial guide based on lessons learned from two father figures.

title: The Silent Patient

synopsis: A woman accused of murder stops speaking, leaving a therapist to uncover the truth.

title: Shantaram

synopsis: An escaped convict builds a new life in the underworld of Bombay.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
synopsis: A boy survives a shipwreck and forms an unlikely bond with a tiger.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
synopsis: Two people navigate a complex, on-and-off relationship over several years.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
synopsis: Four sisters come of age during the American Civil War, facing love and hardship.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
synopsis: In a repressive society, women are valued only for their ability to reproduce.

title: Charlotte's Web
author: E.B. White
synopsis: A pig named Wilbur befriends a spider who weaves messages to save his life.

title: The Paris Library
author: Janet Skeslien Charles
synopsis: The story of Paris librarians during WWII who fought for their readers' freedom.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
synopsis: A father and son struggle to survive in a bleak, post-apocalyptic world.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
synopsis: An alcoholic woman becomes entangled in the disappearance of a young wife.

title: Love in the Time of Cholera

synopsis: A decades-long love story unfolds between two people separated by time and circumstances.

title: I Am Malala
author: Malala Yousafzai
synopsis: The inspiring story of a young Pakistani girl who stood up for education and was shot by the Taliban.

title: The Lovely Bones
author: Alice Sebold
synopsis: A teenage girl watches from the afterlife as her family copes with her tragic death.

title: Outlander

synopsis: The true story of Christopher McCandless, who left society behind to live in the Alaskan wilderness.

title: The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society

synopsis: A correspondence between a writer and residents of a small island blossoms into love.

title: The Chain

synopsis: A mother is forced to commit a crime to save her kidnapped daughter in a twisted extortion plot.

title: The Bridges of Madison County

synopsis: A brief but transformative affair between a photographer and a lonely housewife.

synopsis: The true story of the Manson Family murders, written by the lead prosecutor.

title: The Help

title: Murder on the Orient Express

synopsis: Detective Hercule Poirot solves a baffling murder aboard a luxurious train.

title: Me Before You

title: Eat, Pray, Love
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
synopsis: A woman travels the world in search of self-discovery after a painful divorce.

title: The Night Circus

synopsis: A magical competition between two rivals sparks love and mystery.

title: Rebecca

synopsis: A young bride uncovers dark secrets about her husband's deceased first wife.

title: The Devil in the White City

synopsis: The chilling true story of a serial killer during the 1893 Chicago World's Fair.

title: Call Me by Your Name

title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower

title: Before We Were Strangers

title: Falling

title: Twilight

synopsis: A high school girl falls in love with a vampire, sparking a supernatural romance.

title: The Alchemist

synopsis: A chilling true crime account of Ann Rule's friendship with serial killer Ted Bundy.

author: Liane Moriarty

title: The Fault in Our Stars

title: A Man Called Ove

title: The Rosie Project

title: The Goldfinch

title: The Catcher in the Rye

title: The Shadow of the Wind

synopsis: A boy discovers a cursed book that changes the course of his life forever.

title: The House in the Cerulean Sea

title: Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil

title: Goodnight Moon
author: Margaret Wise Brown

title: Becoming Myself

title: Shogun

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
synopsis: In a seemingly perfect society, a boy discovers the dark secrets of his world.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
synopsis: A story of love and sacrifice set against the backdrop of the French Revolution.

title: Atomic Habits

synopsis: A hobbit embarks on an unexpected adventure to reclaim a treasure guarded by a dragon.

title: Gone Girl

synopsis: A husband becomes the prime suspect when his wife goes missing under suspicious circumstances.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck

author: Aldous Huxley

title: The Secret History

title: Where the Crawdads Sing

title: Educated

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
synopsis: A young heir must navigate politics and mysticism on a desert planet.

synopsis: A young girl comes of age in the slums of Brooklyn during the early 20th century.

title: The Mountain Between Us

title: The Glass Hotel

title: Euphoria
